name: Holy Basil
climate: Holy Basil thrives in warm, tropical climates and cannot tolerate frost.
It prefers a hot, humid environment similar to its native Indian habitat.
Ensure temperatures remain between 70-90Â°F for ideal growth.
It is not suitable for cold climates and requires protection from frost.
sunlight: Holy Basil requires full sunlight for at least 6 to 8 hours a day.
The plant benefits from morning sun and some afternoon shade in hot climates.
Direct sunlight helps Holy Basil develop its characteristic aroma and flavor.
In regions with intense sun, partial shade during peak hours is advisable.
watering: Holy Basil prefers consistently moist soil but should not be waterlogged.
Water the plant deeply and allow the top inch of soil to dry between watering.
Adjust watering frequency based on climate and pot size to avoid root rot.
In dry spells, increase watering frequency to maintain healthy foliage.
soil: Holy Basil grows best in well-drained, fertile soil rich in organic matter.
Ideal soil pH should be slightly acidic to neutral, around 6 to 7.5.
In containers, use a quality potting mix with added compost for nutrients.
Improving drainage with materials like sand or perlite benefits soil structure.
extra_care_tip: Prune Holy Basil regularly to encourage bushy growth and prevent legginess.
Remove flower heads to prolong leaf production and maintain plant energy.
Companion planting with pest-repelling herbs can improve its growth and health.
